sen.j: 四万十川の戦い（しまんとがわのたたかい）は、「渡川の戦い」ともいい、天正3年（1575年）に発生した長宗我部元親の土佐国（高知県）統一を決定づけた戦い。
sen.e: The Battle of Shimanto-gawa River, which is also referred to as the 'Battle of Watari-gawa River,' was a battle that confirmed the unification of the Tosa Province (Kochi Prefecture) by Motochika CHOSOKABE in 1575.

The Battle of Shimanto-gawa River, which is also referred to as the 'Battle of Watari-gawa River,' was a battle that confirmed the unification of Tosa Province (Kochi Prefecture) by Motochika CHOSOKABE in 1575.

The Battle of Shimanto-gawa River, which is also referred to as the 'Battle of Watari-gawa River,' was a battle that confirmed the unification of Tosa Province (Kochi Prefecture) by Motochika CHOSOKABE in 1575.

sen.j: 戦いに至るまで
sen.e: The Process leading to the Battle
The Process leading to the Battle
The Process leading to the Battle

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)、土佐西部の幡多郡（現四万十市一帯）に勢力を誇っていた土佐一条氏は、藤原北家五摂家の流れを汲む名門であった。
sen.e: Tosa Ichijo clan was an influential family and a branch of Gosekke, which was the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and ruled Hata District in the western part of Tosa (what is now the area around Shimanto City) during Sengoku period (period of the warring states).

The Tosa Ichijo clan was an influential family and a branch of Gosekke, which was the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and ruled Hata District in the western part of Tosa (what is now the area around Shimanto City) during the Sengoku period (period of the warring states).

The Tosa Ichijo clan was an influential family and a branch of Gosekke, which was the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, and ruled Hata District in the western part of Tosa (what is now the area around Shimanto City) during the Sengoku period (period of the warring states).

sen.j: その高貴な家筋によって周囲の豪族を従え、和をもって土佐西部に大きな勢力を誇っていた。
sen.e: With their distinguished family lineage, the clan subjugated the local clans and had a strong influence over the western part of Tosa where they ruled peacefully.
With their distinguished family lineage, the clan subjugated the local clans and had a strong influence over the western part of Tosa where they ruled peacefully.
With their distinguished family lineage, the clan subjugated the local clans and had a strong influence over the western part of Tosa where they ruled peacefully.

sen.j: しかし長宗我部元親による土佐統一が現実味を帯びてくると、四万十川以東の豪族が次々と元親に下り、一条氏の影響地域は四万十川下流域と以西に押し込められてしまった。
sen.e: However as the unification of Tosa by Motochika CHOSOKABE became increasingly realistic, the local clans who were in the area east of the Shimanto-gawa River turned to Motochika for alliance, and as such, the area where the Ichijo clan could exert their influence was contained within the areas downstream and west of the Shimanto-gawa River.

However as the unification of Tosa by Motochika CHOSOKABE became increasingly realistic, the local clans who were in the area east of the Shimanto-gawa River turned to Motochika for alliance, and as such, the area where the Ichijo clan could exert their influence was contained within the areas downstream and west of the Shimanto-gawa River.

However as the unification of Tosa by Motochika CHOSOKABE became increasingly realistic, the local clans who were in the area east of the Shimanto-gawa River turned to Motochika for alliance, and as such, the area where the Ichijo clan could exert their influence was contained within the areas downstream and west of the Shimanto-gawa River.

sen.j: そして天正2年（1574年）2月、家臣団のクーデターによって一条氏当主・一条兼定は追放されて、妻の実家である大友氏がある豊後国へと逃れた。
sen.e: In February 1574, the vassals of Ichijo clan staged a coup d'état, and the family head Kanesada ICHIJO was driven out and escaped to Bungo Province where his wife's family, the Otomo clan, was.
In February 1574, the vassals of the Ichijo clan staged a coup d'état, and the family head Kanesada ICHIJO was driven out and escaped to Bungo Province where his wife's family, the Otomo clan, was.
In February 1574, the vassals of the Ichijo clan staged a coup, and the family head Kanesada ICHIJO was driven out and escaped to Bungo Province where his wife's family, the Otomo clan, was.
sen.cmt: d’étatを削除しました。wife’sをwife'sに変更しました。

sen.j: 幡多地方はほとんど血が流れることなく長宗我部氏の統治するところとなった。
sen.e: Hata District thus came to be ruled by Motochika CHOSOKABE without bloodshed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。
sen.e: Hata District thus came to be ruled by Motochika CHOSOKABE without bloodshed.
Hata District thus came to be ruled by Motochika CHOSOKABE without bloodshed.

sen.j: しかし翌天正3年（1575年）、九州から戻った一条兼定が伊予国宇和島市で挙兵し、旧臣を従えて本拠地の中村市に帰郷した。
sen.e: The following year in 1575, however, Kanesada Ichijo who came back from Kyushu raised an army in Uwajima City, Iyo Province, and returned to his homebase Nakamura City with an entourage of his old vassals.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。
sen.e: The following year in 1575, however, Kanesada Ichijo who came back from Kyushu raised an army in Uwajima City, Iyo Province, and returned to his home base Nakamura City with an entourage of his old vassals.

The following year in 1575, however, Kanesada Ichijo who came back from Kyushu raised an army in Uwajima City, Iyo Province, and returned to his home base Nakamura City with an entourage of his old vassals.

sen.j: すると一条家への義を感じる土豪がつぎつぎと参陣し、その兵力はたちまち3500に達した。
sen.e: Then the local clans who felt indebted to the Ichijo clan joined the army one after another, and the number of troops rose to 3,500 quickly.
Then the local clans who felt indebted to the Ichijo clan joined the army one after another, and the number of troops rose to 3,500 quickly.
Then the local clans who felt indebted to the Ichijo clan joined the army one after another, and the number of troops rose to 3,500 quickly.

sen.j: 四万十川河口部の西岸、栗本城に本陣を構えた兼定は四万十川に杭を打ち込ませ、地形を利用した迎撃の用意をはじめた。
sen.e: Kanesada established the headquarter in the Kurimoto Castle on the west bank at the mouth of the Shimanto-gawa River, and prepared for the enemy's attack by planting stakes and utilizing the geography.
Kanesada established headquarters in the Kurimoto Castle on the west bank at the mouth of the Shimanto-gawa River, and prepared for the enemy's attack by planting stakes and utilizing the geography.
Kanesada established headquarters in the Kurimoto Castle on the west bank at the mouth of the Shimanto-gawa River, and prepared for the enemy's attack by planting stakes and utilizing the geography.

sen.j: 長宗我部軍が必ず来ることを承知していた。
sen.e: He knew that the army of Chosokabe would arrive sooner or later.
He knew that the army of Chosokabe would arrive sooner or later.
He knew that the army of Chosokabe would arrive sooner or later.

sen.j: 戦いの経過
sen.e: The Process of the Battle
The Process of the Battle
The Process of the Battle

sen.j: 一条方が四万十川以東の集落や中村城の城下町を襲って挑発すると、長宗我部元親はわずか3日後に7300の軍勢を率いて四万十川東岸に現れた。
sen.e: As the Ichijo army provoked the enemy by attacking villages east of the Shimanto-gawa River and the castle town of the Nakamura-jo Castle, Motochika CHOSOKABE arrived on the east bank of the Shimanto-gawa River with the army 7,300 strong after mere three days.

As the Ichijo army provoked the enemy by attacking villages east of the Shimanto-gawa River and the castle town of the Nakamura-jo Castle, Motochika CHOSOKABE arrived on the east bank of the Shimanto-gawa River with the army 7,300 strong after a mere three days.

As the Ichijo army provoked the enemy by attacking villages east of the Shimanto-gawa River and the castle town of the Nakamura-jo Castle, Motochika CHOSOKABE arrived on the east bank of the Shimanto-gawa River with the army 7,300 strong after a mere three days.

sen.j: 当時の土佐には半農半兵から一歩進んだ一領具足はあっても常備軍の制度はなかったから、短期間で多勢を揃え進軍してきた様に寡兵の一条方は仰天したと言われている。
sen.e: Although there was the system of Ichiryo gusoku in Tosa at that time, which allowed local cultivators to arm themselves, there was not the system of a standing army, and as such, when the Chosokabe clan advanced with a large army within a short time, the Ichijo clan with a small army was truly astounded.

Although there was the system of Ichiryo gusoku in Tosa at that time, which allowed local cultivators to arm themselves, there was a standing army, and as such, when the Chosokabe clan advanced with a large army within a short time, the Ichijo clan with a small army was truly astounded.

Although there was the system of Ichiryo gusoku in Tosa at that time, which allowed local cultivators to arm themselves, there was a standing army, and as such, when the Chosokabe clan advanced with a large army within a short time, the Ichijo clan with a small army was truly astounded.

sen.j: 一領具足制度の有効性を物語るエピソードである。
sen.e: This is a telling episode about the efficiency of the Ichiryo gusoku system.
This is a telling episode about the efficiency of the Ichiryo gusoku system.
This is a telling episode about the efficiency of the Ichiryo gusoku system.

sen.j: 四万十川を挟んで東西に陣取った両軍は、まず長宗我部方の挑発ではじまった。
sen.e: The battle between the two armies stationed on the east side and west side of Shimanto-gawa River was started by the provocation of the Chosagabe army.
The battle between the two armies stationed on the east side and west side of Shimanto-gawa River was started by the provocation of the Chosagabe army.
The battle between the two armies stationed on the east side and west side of Shimanto-gawa River was started by the provocation of the Chosagabe army.

sen.j: 第一陣が正面から渡河をするように突出すると、一条方は渡り終えたところに弓矢や鉄砲を浴びせんと後退した。
sen.e: When the first unit of the Chosogabe army advanced head-on into the river, the Ichijo army retreated in order to attack the enemy with arrows and bullets as they reach their side of the river.
When the first unit of the Chosogabe army advanced head-on into the river, the Ichijo army retreated in order to attack the enemy with arrows and bullets as they reached their side of the river.
When the first unit of the Chosogabe army advanced head-on into the river, the Ichijo army retreated in order to attack the enemy with arrows and bullets as they reached their side of the river.

sen.j: 数で劣っている以上、攻めるわけにはいかない。
sen.e: As they are overwhelmed by the sheer number, there was not an option for them to attack.
As they were overwhelmed by the sheer number, there was not an option for them to attack.
As they were overwhelmed by the sheer number, there was not an option for them to attack.

sen.j: ここですかさず、長宗我部方の第二陣に控えていた福留儀重の騎馬隊が、川の上流に向かって駆けだした。
sen.e: At the moment the Chosokabe army took the opportunity of sending the second unit, the cavalry led by Norishige FUKUDOME, which started to run towards the upstream of the river.
At the moment the Chosokabe army took the opportunity to send the second unit, the cavalry led by Norishige FUKUDOME, which started to run upstream.
At the moment the Chosokabe army took the opportunity to send the second unit, the cavalry led by Norishige FUKUDOME, which started to run upstream.

sen.j: 杭のない上流から回り込まれると動揺した一条軍は部隊を分散させ、上流に向かった長宗我部軍を追った。
sen.e: The Ichijo army panicked seeing the enemy's move to attack from the upstream where there were no stakes to protect them, and sent some groups upstream to chase the Chosogabe army, which caused their army to scatter.

The Ichijo army panicked seeing the enemy's move to attack from upstream where there were no stakes to protect them, and sent some groups upstream to chase the Chosogabe army, which caused their army to scatter.

The Ichijo army panicked seeing the enemy's move to attack from upstream where there were no stakes to protect them, and sent some groups upstream to chase the Chosogabe army, which caused their army to scatter.

sen.j: 一条方が分かれた隙を逃さず、長宗我部元親は残った全軍に一斉渡河を命じた。
sen.e: Taking the opportunity as the Ichijo army became divided, Motochika CHOSOKABE ordered the rest of his army to cross the river.
Taking the opportunity as the Ichijo army became divided, Motochika CHOSOKABE ordered the rest of his army to cross the river.
Taking the opportunity as the Ichijo army became divided, Motochika CHOSOKABE ordered the rest of his army to cross the river.

sen.j: 一条方はただでさえ少ない兵力をさらに分散させてしまったため、正面から迫る倍以上の敵軍を迎え撃つだけの余力はなかった。
sen.e: The Ichijo army, which scattered their small army, did not have capacity to counter the head-on attack of the enemy force of more than double in number.
The Ichijo army, which scattered their small army, did not have capacity to counter the head-on attack of the enemy force of more than double in number.
The Ichijo army, which scattered their small army, did not have capacity to counter the head-on attack of the enemy force of more than double in number.

sen.j: しかも一条軍は寄せ集めで指揮系統は統一されていない。
sen.e: Further, the Ichijo army was a quickly assembled army of inconsistent soldiers and there was no unified chain of command.
Further, the Ichijo army was a quickly assembled army of inconsistent soldiers and there was no unified chain of command.
Further, the Ichijo army was a quickly assembled army of inconsistent soldiers and there was no unified chain of command.

sen.j: 長年土佐の中央部で戦い抜いてきた歴戦の強者どもとまともにやり合えるわけもなく、たちまち総崩れとなり敗走した。
sen.e: There was no way that they could squarely fight with the veteran troops who had survived the various battles in central Tosa for a long time, and the Ichijo army collapsed immediately and routed.
There was no way that they could squarely fight with the veteran troops who had survived the various battles in central Tosa for a long time, and the Ichijo army collapsed immediately and was routed.
There was no way that they could squarely fight with the veteran troops who had survived the various battles in central Tosa for a long time, and the Ichijo army collapsed immediately and was routed.

sen.j: 一条方は数百名の死者を出したが、長宗我部方に被害らしい被害ははなかった。
sen.e: While the Ichijo army suffered a loss of a several hundred soldiers, there was no substantial damage to the Chosokabe army.
While the Ichijo army suffered a loss of a several hundred soldiers, there was no substantial damage to the Chosokabe army.
While the Ichijo army suffered a loss of a several hundred soldiers, there was no substantial damage to the Chosokabe army.

sen.j: 土佐における天下分け目の合戦であった四万十川の戦いは、わずか半日で終わった。
sen.e: The Battle of Shimanto-gawa River, which was the deciding battle for the ruling of Tosa, lasted only half a day.
The Battle of Shimanto-gawa River, which was the deciding battle for the ruling of Tosa, lasted only half a day.
The Battle of Shimanto-gawa River, which was the deciding battle for the ruling of Tosa, lasted only half a day.

sen.j: 夕日が中村平野を染める前に首実検を行えたほどである。
sen.e: They even carried out kubijikken (identifying of severed heads) before the sun had set over the Nakamura Plain.
They even carried out kubijikken (identifying of severed heads) before the sun had set over the Nakamura Plain.
They even carried out kubijikken (identifying of severed heads) before the sun had set over the Nakamura Plain.

sen.j: 戦いのあと
sen.e: After the Battle
After the Battle
After the Battle

sen.j: この戦いで兼定はかろうじて逃げ延び命長らえたが復讐戦の契機は訪れず、隠遁の末に10年後に40歳で死去した。
sen.e: Kanesada Ichijo, who escaped with his bare life from the battle, did not have another opportunity for a revenge battle, and he died at the age of 40 after living in retirement for 10 years.
Kanesada Ichijo, who barely escaped with his life from the battle, did not have another opportunity for a revenge battle, and he died at the age of 40 after living in retirement for 10 years.
Kanesada Ichijo, who barely escaped with his life from the battle, did not have another opportunity for a revenge battle, and he died at the age of 40 after living in retirement for 10 years.

sen.j: 一方長宗我部元親は土佐一国を完全に統一し、やがて四国制覇に赴くこととなる。
sen.e: Motochika CHOSOKABE, on the other hand, unified Tosa Province, and then went on to dominate Shikoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。
sen.e: Motochika CHOSOKABE, on the other hand, unified Tosa Province, and then went on to dominate Shikoku.
Motochika CHOSOKABE, on the other hand, unified Tosa Province, and then went on to dominate Shikoku.

sen.j: しかし天正13年（1585年）、四国平定からわずか数週間後に豊臣秀吉の侵攻を受けて夢は終わった。
sen.e: His tempt, however, was interfered by the invasion of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI merely a few weeks after he dominated Shikoku in 1585.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処をしました。
sen.e: His attempt, however, was interrupted by the invasion of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI merely a few weeks after he dominated Shikoku in 1585.
